result.execSummary:
The defendant Minh Q Trinh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 4 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to Court costs, DNA surcharge and Image surcharge.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Sex offender treatment.
Sex offender registry compliance (15 year requirement).
Not to use or possess any electronic devices that have internet access without the permission of the supervising agent.
Not to possess any adult pornography.
No use or possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Court orders that any devices seized by law enforcement is forfeited and can be detroyed pursuant to statute.

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Minh Q Trinh in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant's therapist and brother presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  10 Years.
Initial Confinement:  3 Years.
Extended Supervision:  7 Years.
4 Days Credit.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
  
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Sex offender treatment.
Sex offender registry compliance (15 year requirement).
Not to use or possess any electronic devices that have internet access without the permission of the supervising agent. 
Not to possess any adult porography.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided.

Image Surcharge:  $5,000 (Both state and defense have stipulated to 10 images with a surcharge of $500 for each image).
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail and refund balance to the posting party.

Court orders that any devices seized by law enforcement is forfeited and can be destroyed pursuant to statute.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

Defendant remanded to the custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant to be transferred to DCI - FORTHWITH.
